channel.title: Asterix - Economy (UPDATED)
channel.description:
[center][IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/2ntcvmo.png[/img][/center]
I've been developing this server with Seif (B2300_T4nk) for a couple of months now, and were near to perfecting it. Asterix is been updated to for fill the lovers of Economy.
[b][size=14pt]Features:[/size][/b]
[ul][li]Random revenant's located in the wilderness and a revenant dungeon - watch video for more[/li] [li]Hyperion's game engine[/li] [li]New path finding system along with clipped combat[/li] [li]Along with the new region system, I've also got rid of the World class, which contained: Virtual World, B, C I and Z[/li] [li]Implemented a new region system; as the old one had been throwing consecutive task errors, as well as bugs with the combat [/li] [li]Path finding system[/li] [li]255 region fix - even though it's pointless, because we won't get 255 players in a region[/li] [li]Deadlocks fixed[/li] [li]Shut down hook fixed[/li] [li]Item packet dupes fixed, along with all the other main ones[/li] [li]Perfected earning potential system - which gives a random loot depending on your %[/li] [li]Summoning[/li] [li]Xml saving and reading[/li] [li]Title system[/li] [li]Quick prayers[/li] [li]Damage soaking[/li] [li]Pets, gecko's, birds etc[/li] [li]Quick prayers[/li] [li]Perfected switching[/li] [li]Near perfect melee combat[/li] [li]Perfected range combat - based on RuneWiki's[/li] [li]Magic combat - still improving[/li] [li]New right context menu's like RuneScape[/li] [li]New loading interface[/li] [li]Bounty hunter - just have the mapdata, will be adding the actual thing very soon[/li] [li]Clipped following[/li] [li]Fully working Chaos tunnel; bork, all npc's, mapdata. Every portal, exit and entrance work. Not only that but it's in wilderness and is multi![/li] [li]No frame skipping[/li] [li]All skills have been re-done, not a single one is using process()[/li] [li]Fully working ancient effigies[/li] [li] Integrated music system, which uses Javazoom (for custom music)[/li] [li]Lots of training grounds, like ghouls for instance[/li][/ul]
[b][size=14pt]Team:[/size][/b]
[ul][li]Int Bauk - Server developer, forum developer[/li] [li]B2300 T4nk - Forum developer, idea feed[/li] [li]Pot up pls - [/li] [li]tom_BETA - Forum moderation (occasionally)[/li][/ul]
[IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/35n99i0.gif[/img]
[IMG]http://i44.tinypic.com/izz5lv.gif[/img]
[IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/xftc0k.png[/img] [IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/10op8x0.png[/img] [IMG]http://i43.tinypic.com/1zsllh.png[/img] [IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/k11y9.png[/img] [IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/rtqbkx.png[/img] [IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/33583te.png[/img] [IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/2zoy81k.png[/img]
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YKHWZCI45_Y&feature=plcp&context=C4f8d8a6VDvjVQa1PpcFOfOVbKuT4OidSg8_fmr1NM7jiilU4R3ww=[/youtube]
More pictures coming soon, not much to take pictures of.

item.title: Asterix - Economy (UPDATED)
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:69, topic:434926”]Not high memory usage, it’s definitely a leak. (whenever something is loaded using the V-World class or ‘clipped’ with the Z class the memory spikes, something to do with the hash table.)

And, they were only used to attempt clipping (by loading the world-map, then declaring the tiles and whatever is else it did from a hash table), if you were to look deep down, there is some code that is commented out related to clipping, in NPC handler and such.

Looked similar to the V-World declaration, a loop, then moving the player based on the tile loop, best I could explain it. Heh.[/quote]

Not sure if that’s bad or not.

Read full topic

item.title: Asterix - Economy (UPDATED)
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Not high memory usage, it’s definitely a leak. (whenever something is loaded using the V-World class or ‘clipped’ with the Z class the memory spikes, something to do with the hash table.)

And, they were only used to attempt clipping (by loading the world-map, then declaring the tiles and whatever is else it did from a hash table), if you were to look deep down, there is some code that is commented out related to clipping, in NPC handler and such.

Looked similar to the V-World declaration, a loop, then moving the player based on the tile loop, best I could explain it. Heh.

Read full topic

item.title: Asterix - Economy (UPDATED)
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:67, topic:434926”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=537645.msg3936450#msg3936450 date=1331079050]
VirtualWorld, B, C, I, Z aren’t used for anything, one, two, there is a leak in the system.

also, @ Allison difference is

                        addPlayerList.add(id);
                        addPlayerSize++;
                        
                        PlayerHandler.players[id].addPlayerList.add(playerId);
                        PlayerHandler.players[id].addPlayerSize++;

[/quote]

They used to be used for loading the world map, but it’s outdated now that the region class got leaked.

And are u sure it’s just not high memory allocation or is it for sure a memory leak?[/quote]

think it’s a memory leak. came to my attention when looking at it on jprofiler.

Read full topic

item.title: Asterix - Economy (UPDATED)

item.description:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:66, topic:434926”]VirtualWorld, B, C, I, Z aren’t used for anything, one, two, there is a leak in the system.

also, @ Allison difference is

[code=java]
addPlayerList.add(id);
addPlayerSize++;

                    PlayerHandler.players[id].addPlayerList.add(playerId);
                    PlayerHandler.players[id].addPlayerSize++;

[/code][/quote]

They used to be used for loading the world map, but it’s outdated now that the region class got leaked.

And are u sure it’s just not high memory allocation or is it for sure a memory leak?

Read full topic

item.title: Asterix - Economy (UPDATED)
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

imsuperman05:

So, Hyperions region/location system?

as well as event, tick/task etc…

Loveandpower:

Correct me if I am wrong but isn’t it already set like that?(in pi)

no, in pi it’s like;

[code]package server.world.map;

import java.util.Hashtable;
import java.util.Map;

public class VirtualWorld
{

public VirtualWorld()
{
}

public static final void main(String args[])
{
    init();
}

public static final void init()
{
    for(int i = 0; i < 10331; i++)
    {
        I[i] = null;
        I[i] = new Hashtable();
    }

    server.world.map.I.I(true);
    for(int j = 0; j < 0x989680; j++)
        I(0, 3222, 3242, 3223, 3243, 0);

}

public static final boolean I(int height, int currentX, int currentY, int futureX, int futureY, int a)
{
	if (height % 4 == 0)
		height = 0;
	if (currentX != futureX && futureY != currentY) {
		return server.world.map.I.I(height, currentX, currentY, currentX, futureY, a) && server.world.map.I.I(height, currentX, currentY, futureX, currentY, a) 
				&& server.world.map.I.I(height, currentX, currentY, futureX, futureY, a);
	}
    return server.world.map.I.I(height, currentX, currentY, futureX, futureY, a);
}

public static Map I[] = new Hashtable[10331];

}
[/code]

then uses:

B
C
I
Z

Read full topic
